newsitem.title: JAPAN: Toshiba says to make, sell colour TVs in Vietnam.
newsitem.headline: Toshiba says to make, sell colour TVs in Vietnam.

text.p: Toshiba Corp said on Monday that it had set up a joint venture in Vietnam to produce and sell colour television sets.
The venture, called Toshiba Vietnam Consumer Products Co Ltd, was formed in Ho Chi Minh City on October 1, Toshiba said in a statement.
The venture, capitalised at $2 million, is 64 percent owned by Toshiba unit Toshiba Singapore Pte Ltd and 36 percent by Viettronics Thu Duc Co, a Vietnamese consumer products maker, Toshiba said.
Construction and manufacturing equipment costs will amount to about $6.7 million by March 1999, Toshiba said.
Production is scheduled to begin in July 1997 and initial production capacity of 88,000 units a year is expected, it said.
The company will make 14-inch, 20-inch and 21-inch colour TVs, Toshiba said.
The venture will initially hire 140 employees, rising to 220 in 1999, Toshiba said.
The venture's output will be sold in Vietnam and exported to other Asian countries as well, Toshiba said.
